Metadata: Ingestion, absorption, and gonad production of adult "Strongylocentr​otus franciscanus" fed different rations of a prepared diet
"Journal of the World Aquaculture Society," 30(3):364- 370, September 1999.

"Strongylocentr​otus franciscanus" is the major sea urchin species fished on the west coast of North America and has become a candidate for aquaculture as populations have declined. Because feed costs are a major portion of operating costs in any form of intensive aquaculture, accurate estimates of the effect of ration on production are vital for cost-effective feeding. Here the authors report the effect of ration on gonad production in "S. franciscanus" and on rates of ingestion and absorption to give insight into the processes involved.
